alert.note: Alert for Beaver (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 2:32PM CDT until July 11 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Beaver River at Beaver affecting Beaver County. For the Beaver River...including Beaver...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Beaver River at Beaver. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor overbank flooding of farm and ranch land occurs. No significant damage expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.3 feet early Friday afternoon. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM CDT.
